entry.title: Photos: Hunger Games Primer

link.Abstract: Consult this handy cheat sheet to brush up on your Hunger Games knowledge.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: The Hunger Games movie is about to hit, and it's poised to make the Twilight phenomenon look like a box office blip. But what if you don't know your Panem from your Primrose, and can't tell the difference between a jabberjay and a tracker jacker? Don't worry, we've got you covered. Consult this handy cheat sheet and brush up on your HG trivia before the film is released. -Jen McDonnell/Dose.ca
link.Credit: The Hunger Games: Official Illustrated Movie Companion
link.title: The Hunger Games movie is about to hit, and it's poised to make the Twilight phenomenon look like a box office blip.

link.Abstract: Cinna (Lenny Kravitz) meets Katniss (Jennifer Lawrence) in this Hunger Games sneak peek. (We also posted something about The Muppets.)
link.title: Your First Look at the Hunger Games' Cinna in Action

link.Abstract: The Hunger Games Mall Tour is underway, and we've got photos of stars Jennifer Lawrence, Liam Hemsworth and Josh Hutcherson at L.A.'s Westfield Century City mall. They're signing autographs like their lives depend on it!
link.title: Photos: Hunger Games Hits the Mall

entry.content: Consult this handy cheat sheet to brush up on your Hunger Games knowledge.

entry.title: Top 10 Parties in Movies

link.Abstract: Here are ten of film’s greatest throw-downs.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: As any 15-year-old knows, sex and popularity are only one great house party away. Which is exactly why the three friends at the centre of Project X disregard sanity, potential grounding for life and insurance premiums to throw what may be the most epic and destructive house party of all time. Of course, Project X’s horny teens are only the latest example of ultimate movie bashes. Here are ten of film’s greatest throw-downs.
link.title: Top 10 Parties in Movies

link.Abstract: Keg stands are more fun if you have someone to share them with. Here are 10 movie characters we want to party with.
link.title: Top 10 Characters We Want to Party With

entry.title: Top 10 Memory Loss Movies

link.Abstract: Inspired by The Vow, Here's a look at 10 other movies that feature forgetful characters.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: In The Vow, a young husband (Channing Tatum) tries to make his bride (Rachel McAdams) fall in love with him all over again after a serious car accident leaves her with severe memory loss. And while Mr. Tatum surely has a hard romantic hill to climb, he's certainly not the first to try to reach the apex of memory loss mountain. Here's a look at 10 other movies that feature forgetful characters.
link.title: In The Vow, a young husband (Channing Tatum) tries to make his bride (Rachel McAdams) fall in love with him all over again after a serious car accident leaves her with severe memory loss.

link.Abstract: Rachel McAdams and Channing Tatum star in The Vow, opening this weekend. I'd tell you what it's about, but I forgot. Does it involve vampires? Buddhist monks? No? Well, here are my best guesses, anyway.

entry.title: Oscar Nominations: The 20 Biggest Snubs and Surprises

link.Abstract: Who got a surprise nomination? Who was left off the list? Check out our reaction to the 2012 Academy Awards nominations.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Oscar Snub - Best Picture: No Nomination for Bridesmaids With the new rules surrounding this year's Best Picture nominees (the voting system changed to a preferential ballot), many believed that the number of films wouldn't be anywhere close to last year's 10. So it was a surprise that nine movies made it onto the list (most seemed to think there'd be seven). And still, even with a greater than expected number of nominees, the crowd-pleaser Bridesmaids didn't make the cut. Apparently, being universally loved and financially successful wasn't enough to woo stuffy Academy voters, who instead opted to nominate the box office disappointment Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close. We guess we should just be happy with Melissa McCarthy's Best Supporting Actress nod. It's not every day the Academy recognizes a sink-pooping scene stealer.
link.title: Oscar Snub - Best Picture: No Nomination for Bridesmaids

link.Abstract: Check out who has been nominated for the 84th annual Academy Awards, taking place Feb. 26, 2012.
link.title: Oscar Nominations Announced

link.Abstract: Join Dose.ca's Jen McDonnell and Postmedia's Jay Stone as they discuss the nominations - from the surprises to the snubs and everything in between.
link.title: Join Our Oscar Nominations Live Chat

entry.content: Who got a surprise nomination? Who was left off the list? Check out our reaction to the 2012 Academy Awards nominations.

entry.title: Top 10 Heist Movies

link.Abstract: The characters in these suspenseful flicks have stolen gold, jewels and money -- and our hearts.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
It's difficult, if not impossible, to resist a movie featuring charismatic people stealing stuff. In Man on a Ledge, Sam Worthington's character creates the ultimate distraction on a Manhattan hotel rooftop while his cohorts attempt the biggest diamond heist ever committed, all in an attempt to prove his innocence.
But successful heist movies don't necessarily need a plot based on revenge and justice, and we've put together the Top 10 Heist Movies to prove it. The characters in these suspenseful flicks have stolen gold, jewels and money, but they've also stolen the most valuable thing of all: our hearts.
--Dose.ca
link.title: In Man on a Ledge, Sam Worthington's character creates the ultimate distraction on a Manhattan hotel rooftop while his cohorts attempt the biggest diamond heist ever committed, all in an attempt to prove his innocence.

link.Abstract: Break out your tinfoil hats, because we’re counting down our favourite conspiracy movies.
link.title: Top 10 Conspiracy Movies

link.title: Top 10 Clumsy Crooks

entry.content: The characters in these suspenseful flicks have stolen gold, jewels and money -- and our hearts.

entry.title: Top 10 Survival Movies

link.Abstract: We've picked 10 of our favourite survival movies. No guarantee you'll learn anything from them, but at least you won't risk losing an arm.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Imagine, if you will, that you're Liam Neeson. Apart from that Phantom Menace business, not so bad, right? Dude's a badass with an OBE. Now, imagine Liam Neeson's plane has crashed in the Arctic. He has no food, no shelter, no trendy Canada Goose parka to keep him warm -- and he's also being stalked by wolves who think he's Puppy Chow. That's the premise of The Grey, opening this weekend. Fingers crossed our guy makes it out with a mere case of frostbite. If we've learned anything from outdoor adventure movies, it's that Hollywood stars are extraordinarily hearty. Whether faced with threat of starvation, lethal predators -- or a lethal "Predator" -- they've got what it takes. We've picked 10 of our favourite survival movies. No guarantee you'll learn anything from them, but at least you won't risk losing an arm.
link.title: The Grey, 2012: Liam Neeson's plane has crashed in the Arctic. He has no food, no shelter, no trendy Canada Goose parka to keep him warm

link.Abstract: At age 59, Liam Neeson is surprised to find he's become an action star.
link.title: Neeson Battles Nature in The Grey

link.Abstract: You can survive zombie attacks, alien invasions, natural diasasters and more -- if you watch these films for tips!
link.title: Hollywood Guide to Survival

entry.content: We've picked 10 of our favourite survival movies. No guarantee you'll learn anything from them, but at least you won't risk losing an arm.

entry.title: Gallery: Oscar Nominees React

link.Abstract: Who promised his coworkers pancakes? Who called the news "numbing"? Read the reactions from the newest batch of Oscar nominees.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Brad Pitt (Best Actor Nominee, Moneyball)
"This is an extraordinary honor. I am dizzy with joy...and caffeine. Considering both films, Moneyball and The Tree of Life, nearly didn't make it to the screen, this is especially sweet. And I'd like to thank all the artisans and craftsmen who gave their best to each film. I am especially over the moon for Jonah (and the other Moneyballers acknowledged today), Terry Malick and the tribute this is to Billy Beane and the Oakland A's organization. My congratulations to all the nominees...pancakes for everyone!"
link.title: Brad Pitt: "I am dizzy with joy...and caffeine. My congratulations to all the nominees...pancakes for everyone!"

entry.title: Top 10 Star-Studded Duds

link.Abstract: Check out our picks for the Top 10 movies to waste the talents of A-list casts.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Sometimes bigger isn't always better. New Year's Eve is the latest film to hit screens that's chocked full of boldface names, including Michelle Pfeiffer, Zac Efron, Ashton Kutcher, Lea Michele, Katherine Heigl, Halle Berry, Hilary Swank, Robert De Niro, Jessica Biel and Sarah Jessica Parker. But like its predecessor Valentine's Day taught us, some movies struggle to shine, even when they're stuffed with star wattage. Check out our picks for the Top 10 movies to waste the talents of A-list casts.
-Dose.ca

entry.title: Full Frontal: Top 10 Most Awkward Male Nude Scenes

link.Abstract: Sometimes male nudity in movies is funny, sometimes it's just awkward. We're counting down the 10 best films where actors show their naughty bits.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Michael Fassbender is earning rave reviews for his performance in Shame, in which he plays a sex addict living in New York. It's not just his impressive acting that's raising eyebrows; it's also his many full-frontal scenes, which the actor seems to have no problem sharing with the world. "Half of us have a penis and the other half have probably seen one, and so why should it be more normal to, like, chop people's heads off and shoot people?" he recently told the Huffington Post.

We've listed 10 other movies where actors didn't shy from airing their gentleman-parts. Sometimes, hilarity ensues. Other times, however, a dude getting old-man junk in the face just isn't funny. At those moments, there's always the fast-forward button.
--Dose.ca
link.title: Michael Fassbender

link.Abstract: Seeing the Irish/German actor smile makes us smile, so we thought we'd spread the joy.
link.title: Photos: Michael Fassbender's Smile

link.Abstract: Hollywood movies would have us believe that the difference between a beautiful blonde and a social outcast can come down to a pair of glasses.
link.title: Top 20 Homely Hollywood Hotties

entry.title: Top 10 Actors Who Shouldn't Do Drag

link.Abstract: Adam Sandler isn't the only thespian who shouldn't play dressup; here are 10 actors who shouldn't do drag
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
There are few things more disturbing than an ugly cross-dresser. We don't have anything against the practice per se; just have a little pride in your craft. Case in point, Adam Sandler's cringe-worthy turn as his own twin sister in his latest slapstick Jack and Jill, which just happens to open this Friday. Of course, Sandler isn't the first actor to stupidly strap on a bra and call himself a woman; here are 10 other dudes who shouldn't look like ladies.
--Leah Collins and Jon Dekel/Dose.ca
link.title: Top 10 Actors Who Shouldn't Do Drag

entry.title: Top 10 Un-Merry Christmas Movies

link.Abstract: A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas is just the latest Christmas movie to try adding some much needed bite to the most saccharine of seasons. Here are 10 more less-than-merry Christmas movies.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Peace on earth! Good will toward men! Sleigh bells, and jingle bells and chestnuts roasting on an open fire! Thank Jebus we only have to bother with that garbage once a year. Still, the holiday season arrives early this Friday, when A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas arrives in theatres. Mind you, the stoner duo's new holiday "trip" isn't your typical feel-good fare -- and it's just the latest Christmas movie to try adding some much needed bite to the most saccharine of seasons. Here are 10 more less-than-merry Christmas movies.
--Leah Collins and Jon Dekel/Dose.ca
link.title: Harold1

entry.title: Top 10 Clumsy Crooks

link.Abstract: Tower Heist isn't the first time we've seen movie characters who just aren't suited to a life of crime. Check out 10 more clumsy movie crooks.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
In Tower Heist, Ben Stiller and Eddie Murphy lead a group of hard-working guys who conspire to rob a wealthy businessman's high-rise residence after they fall victim to his Ponzi scheme. Presumably, hijinks ensues. Their chances of making off with the loot are slightly less certain.
There's a long history of movie characters who just aren’t suited to a life of crime. Here are just 10 of these clumsy crooks. --Leah Collins and Miranda Furtado/Dose.ca

entry.title: Top 10 Men in Tights

link.Abstract: All for one, and one-size fits all! Since The Three Musketeers are returning to the big screen this week, we're counting down our 10 favourite movie men in tights.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
All for one, and one-size fits all. Athos, Porthos and Aramis might not ever say that little maxim out loud, but it's pretty much the unofficial motto of The Three Musketeers. Because sure as those French swashbucklers belong on the big screen -- their latest incarnation debuts this week -- they belong in tights. The trio isn't alone, of course. There may be just three musketeers, but there are countless more movie men in tights (D'Artagnan, included). Here are just 10 of our favourites.
--Leah Collins and Jon Dekel/Dose.ca
link.title: Top 10 Men in Tights

entry.title: Top 10 Film Soundtracks

link.Abstract: We're counting down our ten favourite movie soundtracks.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
What makes some film soundtracks transcend from mere background music to something sublime? Is it a clever mix of zeitgeist-capturing singles or the lightning in a bottle brilliance of the right artist for the right project at the right time? Is it a solid collection of older material that re-introduces new fans to music of another time? Or is it the debut of a new sound, for a new film for a new era? In a word: yes!

In honor of Footloose — a remake that promises to make us want to kick off our Sunday shoes — we take a look at ten kickass soundtracks.
link.title: Top 10 Film Soundtracks

link.Abstract: From the hand-jiving hooligans of Grease to the dancing rivals of West Side Story, it seems teenagers and musical numbers go together as well as Disney stars and purity rings. Here are our picks for the 10 best musical movies about teens.

entry.title: Top 10 Conspiracy Movies

link.Abstract: Break out your tinfoil hats, because we’re counting down our favourite conspiracy movies.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
In The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, a powerful man hires journalist Mikael Blomkvist (Daniel Craig) to search for a relative who has been missing for forty years. Blomkvist is aided by computer hacker Lisbeth Salander (Rooney Mara), and together they uncover a complicated conspiracy. What happened to the girl? Why are her relatives hampering the investigation? Moreover, why do conspiracies like this always turn up in blockbuster movies?

Break out your tinfoil hats, because we’re counting down our favourite conspiracy movies.
Dose.ca
link.title: In The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

entry.title: Top 10 Movie Robots

link.Abstract: We're taking a look at some of the best movie robots to ever step off an assembly line.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
One thing that Hollywood may like more than money are robots. Okay, unless they’re robots that turn garbage into money then probably not as much as money, but still, close enough. Robots come in all shapes and sizes and looks. From ones that can pass for Nicole Kidman or Arnold Schwarzenegger, to crazy tin can-looking ones with one big red eye that speak in bleeps and blips—robots make movies better in the same exponential way that monkeys and ninjas do. We're taking a look at some of the best movie robots to ever step off an assembly line.

-Ben Carrozza, Leah Collins/Dose.ca
link.title: Top 10 Movie Robots

-Dose.ca

entry.title: Top 10 Movie Assassins

link.Abstract: In Hollywood, the assassins are either ultra-glam or incredibly shadowy — making them ridiculously fun to watch.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
In real life, assassinations are unfortunate and gruesome. But in Hollywood, the assassins are either ultra-glam or incredibly shadowy — plus they have high-tech weaponry, million-dollar contracts and shady mafia connections — making them ridiculously fun to watch.
Take new assassin movie, Colombiana, which stars Zoe Saldana who grows up to be a stone-cold assassin after witnessing her parents' murder as a child in Bogota.
In celebration, we've compiled a list of our Top 10 assassins in film. These are the men and women whose adherence to the killer's code makes them the ideal people to call if you ever need to buy someone a pine condo.
link.title: Top 10 Movie Assassins

link.Abstract: We’d count on Jesse Eisenberg to bring us pizza, operate theme-park rides -- maybe even create Facebook. But pulling off a major bank heist? The 30 Minutes Or Less star isn't the first to bumble through a burglary, though. Here are just 10 more crappy movie crooks.
link.title: Top 10 Clumsy Crooks

entry.title: Top 10 Body-Switching Movies

author.name: Ryan Bolton and Kat Angus / Dose.ca

link.Abstract: In honour of The Change-Up (premiering August 5), we’re counting down the best body-switching movies.
link.Credit: Ryan Bolton and Kat Angus / Dose.ca
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: We've all looked at our best friend and have thought the grass is greener on the other side. But is it? Cooler cars, financial freedom or a hotter partner is enough to make anyone daydream about switching lives. Hollywood loves a good out-of-body experience, whether it’s an unsatisfied youngster waking up as an adult, two polar-opposites switching places for a day or two bitter enemies surgically swapping faces for reasons that aren’t entirely clear. In honour of The Change-Up (premiering August 5), we’re counting down the best body-switching movies.

entry.title: Top 10 Unlikely Cowboys

link.Abstract: Cowboys & Aliens, out July 29, reminded us of 10 cowpokes who aren't exactly at home on the range.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
You're an amnesiac.
You're on the run from the law.
You've got some kind of wrist-weight covered with Christmas lights stuck on your arm.
That's the situation facing Jake Lonergan (Daniel Craig) at the beginning of Cowboys & Aliens, opening July 29.
Add all those factors up, and we'd say ol' Jake is one unlikely cowboy hero. (Well, the fact he's being played by James M.F. Bond, aside.)
Jake's not the only cowpoke to seem more out of place on the prairie than a Sunday bonnet on an Apaloosa's cornhole. Here are 10 more movie cowboys who aren't quite at home on the range.
--Leah Collins and Miranda Furtado/Dose.ca
link.title: Top 10 Unlikely Cowboys
